alert.note: Alert for Interstate 5 Corridor (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 10:06AM PST until January 07 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Light to moderate snow is expected, and will combine with damaging northwest to north winds. Snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches are expected above 4500 feet, with accumulations of 1 to 3 inches between 3500 and 4500 feet. Northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts to 60 to 70 mph are expected tonight and Sunday morning. Localized gusts to 80 mph are possible. * WHERE...Interstate 5 Corridor and surrounding mountains in northwest Los Angeles County. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to low visibilities and snow covered roads with localized blizzard conditions likely. Very strong winds may cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will likely come to a end by Sunday afternoon, but strong winds will continue to cause reduced visibility at times due to blowing snow through Sunday evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.
